briefTitle: Study of Brolucizumab in Adult Patients With Suboptimal Anatomically Controlled Neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration
officialTitle: A One-year, Single-arm, Open-label, Multicenter Study Assessing the Effect of Brolucizumab on Disease Control in Adult Patients With Suboptimal Anatomically Controlled Neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration (SWIFT)
summary: Neovascular age-related macular degeneration is characterized by the presence of choroidal neovascularization (CNV), which consists of abnormal blood vessels originating from the choroid that can lead to hemorrhage, fluid exudation, and fibrosis, resulting in photoreceptor damage and vision loss.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Patients With no Disease Activity at Week 16 in the Study Eye

commonTop: Neovascular age-related macular degeneration - Fellow eye
